question: which animal on earth has the longest life span
api_result: As of the latest information available, the animal with the longest known lifespan is the Greenland shark. Some studies suggest that Greenland sharks can live for more than 400 years, potentially making them the longest-living vertebrates on Earth. Another notable mention is the ocean quahog, a type of clam, which can also live for over 400 years, with the oldest recorded individual, named Ming, estimated to be 507 years old at the time of its death.
